summary: This is an email from Gary Bloxsome, a partner at Blackfords LLP, to the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ), criticizing the DOJ's handling of its request for an interview with the Duke of York (Prince Andrew). The email alleges the DOJ broke a promise of confidentiality and used the request for publicity, leading the Duke to withdraw his offer to cooperate with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Gary Bloxsome
persons.role: Partner at Blackfords LLP, legal representative for the Duke of York
persons.context: Author of the email, acting as the legal representative for the Duke of York in communications with the DOJ regarding the Duke's potential cooperation with the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Duke of York
persons.role: Prince Andrew, potential witness in the Epstein investigation
persons.context: The subject of the DOJ's interview request. His legal team states he initially intended to cooperate but has now withdrawn due to the DOJ's alleged breach of confidentiality and pursuit of publicity.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Accused by the email's author of making a public statement about the Duke of York on January 27, 2020, which breached an agreed-upon confidentiality and misrepresented the Duke's level of cooperation.

Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading an investigation for which the Duke of York was requested to provide assistance as a potential witness.

events.title: DOJ's Initial Contact with Duke of York
events.description: The DOJ first attempted to make contact and request the Duke of York's assistance in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: DOJ Confirms Confidentiality
events.description: The DOJ confirmed to the Duke's legal team that any interview arrangements would be kept confidential.

events.title: Legal Team's Timeline Email
events.description: The Duke's legal team emailed the DOJ confirming the Duke's strong desire to cooperate and stating preliminary issues would be addressed within 14 days.

events.title: Berman's Public Statement
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman made a public statement about the Duke of York, leading to press reports of a 'wall of silence' and 'zero cooperation'.

events.title: Withdrawal of Cooperation
events.description: Gary Bloxsome sends this email formally stating the Duke of York will no longer assist the DOJ investigation due to breached confidentiality and publicity concerns.

locations: Croydon, CR0 1EA (Registered office of Blackfords LLP)
keyFacts: The Duke of York (Prince Andrew) was formally requested by the DOJ to assist in the Epstein investigation on January 2, 2020, and was confirmed not to be a target.
The DOJ initially promised confidentiality regarding interview arrangements with the Duke, a promise his legal team claims was later broken.
U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman made a public statement about the Duke on January 27, 2020, which the Duke's legal team says misrepresented his willingness to cooperate and violated confidentiality.
As a direct result of the DOJ's alleged conduct, the Duke of York, through his lawyers, has withdrawn his offer to cooperate with the investigation.
The email accuses the DOJ, specifically SDNY U.S. Attorney Berman, of prioritizing publicity for the prosecution over a proper criminal investigation for Epstein's victims.
